newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Triple-deck stake for Indonesia Citra.
newsitem.headline: Triple-deck stake for Indonesia Citra.

text.p: Indonesian toll road operator and builder PT Citra Marga said on Wednesday it will participate in a 5.82 trillion rupiah ($2.45 billion) triple-deck road and rail project in Jakarta that will begin construction this year.
"We will participate in the project," Citra Marga's investor relations officer, who declined to identified, told Reuters.
He said the firm was considering taking a 19 percent share of the project's total equity but declined to give any further details.
PT Citra Lamtoro Gung Persada, controlled by one of President Suharto's daughters, has said it will launch the road-rail project in April.
The Citra Marga official said as of December 1996, Citra Lamtoro Gung Persada held a 4.4 percent stake in the listed toll-road company PT Citra Marga.
Citra Group's head of corporate public relations Fariza Y. Irawady said on Wednesday the project would be financed 75 percent by loans and 25 percent from equity.
The loans will come 60 percent from local sources and 40 percent from offshore, he added.
He said the project would be a joint-venture between Citra, state-owned toll road operator Jasa Marga and state-owned rail company Perumka.

Irawady said that the triple-deck structure would consist of 23.55 km (14.7 mile) toll-road in the upper part, a 21.25 km (13.2 mile) railway in the middle-part and a public road in the lower part to link south Jakarta and downtown Kota in the north.
Citra Lamtoro Gung Persada, controlled by Suharto's eldest daughter Siti Hardijanti Rukmana, focuses mainly on infrastructure projects.
In mid-afternoon, Citra Marga traded unchanged at 2,075 rupiah on a small volume of 13,500 shares.
